cab.content: Printed for the Cabinet. October 1945.SECRET. Copy No.CP. (45) 204.4th October, 1945.CABINET.PARLIAMENTARY PRIVATE SECRETARIES.Note by the Secretary of the Cabinet.THE Prime Minister has asked me to circulate the attached note aboutParliamentary Private Secretaries and, at the same time, to call their attentiononce more to Section V of CP. (45) 100.The Prime Minister also asks that Ministers will show the note to the Under-Secretaries of their Offices, asking them to bring it, and the section of the cabinet paper referred to above, to the notice of their Parliamentary Private Secretaries.(Signed) E. E. BRIDGES.Cabinet Office, S.W. 1,4th October, 1945.My attention has been called to statements made in the Press by ParliamentaryPrivate Secretaries.The arrangement whereby Members serve as Parliamentary Private Secre-taries is essentially a personal relationship and care must be taken not to makestatements which appear to be made in an official or semi-official capacity.C. R. A.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,4th October, 1945.
